name: 趙莊敏
objective: This course is to build up the financial framework for students when making financial decisions. The focus is on setting out the basic principles of financial management and applying them to the main decisions faced by the financial managers. It helps students to understand various tools of financial management and use them effectively when making investment and financing decisions.
schedule:
1 Introduction
2 The Firm and the Financial Manager
3 Agency Problem
4 Financial Markets and Intermediaries
5 Accounting and Finance
6 Time Value of Money
7 Valuing Bonds
8 Valuing Stocks
9 NPV and Other Investment Criteria
10 Midterm Exam
11 Discounted Cash-Flow Analysis
12 Project Analysis
13 Risk, Return, and Opportunity cost of Capital
14 Case Presentation and Discussions
15 Case Presentation and Discussions
16 Case Presentation and Discussions
17 Case Presentation and Discussions
18 Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Minicase Assignments 25%
Midterm Report 1 25%
Midterm Report 2 25%
Final Report 25%
materials: Brealey, R.A., Myers, S.C., and Marcus, A.J, “Fundamentals of Corporate Finance,”  McGraw-Hill/Irwin.
